title: Expansion of trade between Europe and Asia

content.description:
CLOVE* PRICES IN SOUTHEAST ASIA AND IN AMSTERDAM, 1580–1850

(in Spanish silver reals, a common trade currency in the East Indies)

*Cloves are spices native to the Moluccas islands in eastern Indonesia and, until the late eighteenth century, grown only in Southeast Asia.

Source: David Bulbeck, Anthony Reid, Lay Cheng Tan, and Yiqi Wu, eds. Southeast Asian Exports Since the 14th Century: Cloves, Pepper, Coffee, and Sugar, (Leiden, The Netherlands, KITLV Press), 1988. Graph 2.2., p. 57
content.question: On a global scale, which of the following most directly led to the expansion of the trade between Europe and Asia in the time period reflected in the chart?

choices.label: European merchants’ role in exporting European manufactured goods to Asia
The consistently high demand for European luxury goods among Chinese customers
The shifting balance of trade as a result of the circulation of American silver
The collapse of existing Indian Ocean trading networks

content.answer: The shifting balance of trade as a result of the circulation of American silver
